message_1: What is the remainder when  a prime number, say 17, is raised to the power of another natural number, for example 22, divided by the same prime number? In other words, what is the value of 17^22 (mod 17)?
message_2:
According to Fermat's Little Theorem, if p is a prime number and a is an integer not divisible by p, then a^(p-1) is congruent to 1 modulo p. In other words, a^(p-1) ≡ 1 (mod p).

In this case, p = 17 (a prime number) and a = 17 (not divisible by 17). So, we have:

17^(17-1) ≡ 1 (mod 17)

Now, we want to find the remainder of 17^22 (mod 17). We can rewrite 17^22 as (17^16) * (17^6). Since 17^16 ≡ 1 (mod 17) from Fermat's Little Theorem, we have:

(17^16) * (17^6) ≡ 1 * (17^6) (mod 17)

So, the remainder when 17^22 is divided by 17 is the same as the remainder when 17^6 is divided by 17. Since 17 is divisible by 17, any power of 17 will also be divisible by 17. Therefore, the remainder is 0.
